text: Antonio "Tony" Meloto (born January 17, 1950) is the founder of Gawad Kalinga, a Philippine-based poverty alleviation movement. Meloto was named 2006 "Filipino of the Year" by the Philippine Daily Inquirer. ==Early life and career== Antonio Meloto was born on January 17, 1950 in Bacolod, Negros Occidental to a middle-class family. He took his senior high school year at De Anza High School in Richmond, California as an American Field Service scholar. He earned a Bachelor of Arts in Economics degree from Ateneo de Manila University, studying as a full academic scholar and graduating in 1971. He then took a job as a purchasing manager for Procter and Gamble. ==Couples for Christ and Gawad Kalinga== Meloto became an active member of Couples for Christ in 1985 and quickly rose in leadership, having a key role in establishing CFC Family Ministries in 1993. In 1995 he began a youth development program for juvenile delinquents in Caloocan City. The program evolved into Gawad Kalinga, a global movement for building sustainable communities within slum areas. In 2006 he was awarded the Ramon Magsaysay Award for Community Leadership. ==Criticism== In May 2015, Meloto generated controversy for allegedly sexist remarks made at a conference at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. ==References== ==External links== *Gawad Kalinga Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:Filipino philanthropists Category:People from Bacolod Category:Ramon Magsaysay Award winners Category:Ateneo de Manila University alumni Category:Winners of the Nikkei Asia Prize
